duties_responsibilities.duty: Properly prepare all food items listed on the menu, including grilling, frying, broiling, baking, boiling, and braising.
Cook on the Wok station with at least 5 years of high-volume scratch kitchen experience.
Prepare Chinese Wok Dishes and preferably have knowledge of Vietnamese, Thai, and other Asian cuisines.
Create an inviting atmosphere for guests and actively build and retain guest relations.
Mentor team members to provide superior guest service.
Ensure the aesthetical appeal and proper cooking of all plates or pans served.
Recognize and properly place a variety of sauces on entrees featured on daily menus.
Maintain a neat and clean workstation.
Assist co-workers for efficient kitchen operation and special events/parties.
Ensure cleanliness of the working area and report any equipment safety failures or hazardous areas.
Properly store foods and ensure full stock of items and good working condition of equipment.
Close down workstations and assist with other duties at special events or parties.
Attend and participate in meetings, completing follow-up as assigned.
Season food according to recipes or company needs and assist other cooks during the food assembly process.
Clean food preparation areas according to company policy and perform work regularly and predictably.
Clean and sanitize work and public spaces as required, as well as other duties as assigned.

education_certification.credential: High School Diploma or Equivalent, with preference for culinary apprenticeship, Associate's Degree in culinary institution, or equivalent with industry experience.
Valid licenses/certifications per Federal, State, and Gaming regulations.
Must successfully pass background check and drug screening.
Must be at least eighteen (18) years of age.
